_exec_summary.SummaryText:
McGean Rohco, Inc, Cleveland Operations
RMP Executive Summary 
July 31, 2024


McGean-Rohco, Inc. develops specialty chemical application technologies, manufactures organic and inorganic chemicals, and provides technical services on a worldwide basis through a network of technical sales representatives, distributors and affiliates. Principal industries served include general metal finishing of ferrous and non-ferrous metals and other materials, fabricating of printed circuits and electronics, manufacturing glass and fiberglass, preparing dyes, pigments and catalyst, and the manufacturing and maintenance of commercial and military aircraft.

McGean-Rohco, Inc. is a member of the Synthetic Organic Chemical Manufacturers Association (SOCMA) and is certified under the SOCMA ChemStewards management system.  We are committed to supporting and continuing efforts to improve the industrys management of chemicals. We pledge to manage our business according to the guiding principles.

McGean-Rohco management is dedicated to the health and safety of its employees, protection of the environment and the well-being of our customers and the community in which we operate.   At McGean-Rohco, Inc. safety s foundation of all our activities.  We value safety on the job and encourage our personnel to take safety, as a value, home with them.  In our world: all accidents are preventable: When incidents occur, they are to be learned from so that future incidents can be prevented; and no job is so important that it cannot be done safely.  Safety is planned into every task; it is the first and last thing we consider. Our employees are empowered and responsible to stop production, without repercussion, if they feel that the task is unsafe for themselves or for others.

McGean Rohcos Cleveland Operations are covered under USEPAs Risk Management Plan (RMP) regulations.  As such, we have developed the required polices, procedures and information required by that regulation.  McGean currently h

andles only one RMP chemical above threshold level:  epichlorohydrin.

The facility includes eight buildings located on a seventeen-acre site in Cleveland, Ohio.  Three of the buildings are used to process chemicals.  Only a portion on one of those buildings, and three outdoor tanks handle epichlorohydrin.  One building contains administrative staff and our QC lab and the remaining buildings are used for warehousing or are vacant.  The manufacturing areas include standard chemical processing equipment, such as storage and mixing tanks, reactors, heat exchangers and pumps. 

USEPAs RMP Comp web-based system was used to evaluate in determining the potential for offsite impacts for various events involving RMP chemicals at our facility.  Included in these analyses was a worst-case scenario.  A summary of each scenario is described below:

Epichlorohydrin: In the worst case, the entire contents of a reactor, including epichlorohydrin, to the building floor (inside) and begins to evaporate.  The epichlorohydrin volume is that of our product which uses the most per batch.   The distance to the impact endpoint is 0.7 miles.  We comply with the requirements of EPAs RMP rule and OSHAs PSM rule including Process Hazard analyses, follow through on recommendations, operating procedures (which include normal start up and shut down, emergency start up and shut down, safe operating limits and actions to take should those limits be approached preventive maintenance on our reactors and vessels, operating procedures and training, emergency procedures.  Our last coordination with local EMS was July 21, 2024.


McGean Rohco has developed and employs procedures to control manufacturing and equipment operation.  In addition, operating procedures have been developed to manage emergencies and prevent chemical spills.    Chemical storage tanks containing RMP chemicals are provided with concrete dikes, and reactors are inside enclosed buildings. Transfers of raw materials and finished pro

ducts are controlled by instrumentation integrated with various safety interlocks. 
 
The emergency procedures were developed with local emergency responders to address any incidents that may occur and are regularly coordinated with those same organizations.  Employees at McGean-Rohco are trained to notify the appropriate responders and other agencies as needed. These are listed in the McGean-Rohco Integrated Contingency Plan.  McGean-Rohco works closely with the Cuyahoga Heights Fire & Police Departments and with its neighbors in training and sharing of information.  Employees have received both on-and off-site training.  Employee training programs are in compliance with the required OSHA regulations and are conducted on a regular basis.  Drills are conducted with local fire departments, hazardous materials teams and industrial neighbors.  Public notification would be through the local fire department and LEPC.  

We have not experienced any accidental release of RMP chemicals in the last five years.  


We periodically review safety procedures and programs and update them as necessary. McGean-Rohco management tracks safety and environmental performance and sets challenging goals to improve the safety and environmental performance.  Process Hazard Analyses, training, quality upgrades and procedural methods are all used to ensure all of McGean-Rohcos facilities operate safely and responsibly.
